labels.analysis: The MCP Server primarily provides AI models with real-time user geolocation data through EdgeOne Pages Functions. Its core functionality revolves around enabling context-aware AI interactions by supplying precise location information, which can enhance various applications that require user or device geolocation. The available tool, "get_geolocation," suggests that the server is focused on retrieving and relaying geolocation data seamlessly for integrated MCP servers.
labels.reasoning: The primary label is selected based on the server's core functionality of providing location-based services. The secondary label relates to its integration capabilities, as it leverages EdgeOne Pages Functions to enhance AI interactions. Custom labeling wasn't required since the predefined categories adequately cover its functionality.

server_info_crawled.name: EdgeOne Geo Location Server
server_info_crawled.author: @kinglionsz/mcp-geo
server_info_crawled.overview: Provide AI models with real-time user geolocation data by integrating EdgeOne Pages Functions with the Model Context Protocol. Enable seamless access to location information through a dedicated MCP tool, enhancing context-aware AI interactions. Simplify deployment and usage with ready-to-use configurations for MCP servers.

tools.name: get_geolocation
tools.description: Deploy Server EdgeOne Geo Location Server Claim Server @kinglionsz/mcp-geo Try in Playground get_geolocation

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@kinglionsz/mcp-geo/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
